question.text:
Given below are two statements:

Statement I: Restriction endonucleases recognise specific sequence to cut DNA known as palindromic nucleotide sequence.

Statement II: Restriction endonucleases cut the DNA strand a little away from the centre of the palindromic site.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:

options.text: Both Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> and Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>II</mi></math> are incorrect

Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> is correct but Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>II</mi></math> is incorrect

Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> is incorrect but Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>II</mi></math> is correct
Both Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> and Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>II</mi></math> are correct

solution.text:
Statement I: Restriction endonucleases do recognise unique sequences to cut the DNA. These sequences are arranged in the form of a palindrome.

So, statement I is correct.

Statement II: Restriction endonucleases cut the DNA strand a little away from the centre of the palindromic site. This helps generate sticky ends.

So, statement II is correct.

Option 4 is correct.

Note: Statement II is correct as per NCERT but is not correct scientifically as a general statement for restriction endonucleases.
